author: A_Brickset_user
title: Solid fire truck set, no frills
review: I'm not quite sure why I got this fire truck, since I had about half a dozen already.  But, it is a nice, fairly ordinary truck design.  It would be nice if the truck were a little larger and more realistic in  looks and came with outriggers.  I have rebuilt it as such in my own collection.

author: mrmitch
title: First Firetruck with Extention Ladder
review: I like this small fire truck! Lady down the street was getting rid of some of her sons old LEGO sets and asked if I wanted to buy some - I said YES. This set was one of them, all from the late 80's and early 90's. There were instructions and a big box of assorted blocks. It took me quite awhile to sort through the box and build the sets. It was alot of fun for me but took a month or so. Back to this truck, it was the very first Extention ladder truck to my collection, I have since add some others. I like the simplicity of the older sets, but the do lack the detail and scale of the newer City sets now available. Good set if you can come across it-even if it dosen't quite fit with the newer fire fighting line up.

author: ratz
title: classic 80's virtues
review: being a quite small set, this one offers a lot of possibilities to play and to modify. there's a lot of extra eqipment, although an additional firefighter would have been nice. anyway, this is one of the first sets that i owned and that fed my upcoming lego addiction...

author: Dclarke81
title: Lovely Ladders
review:
Great little build, well put together, enjoyable to piece together and fun to play with.

Nice addition to the 6389 Fire Control Center. it fits right in the middle opening of the Control Center. I got both together one christmas, really sets it off as it has the ladders :)
